getSupportedOptionalOperations

public java.lang.String[] getSupportedOptionalOperations()
Get the supported optional operations.

Some of the operations on the alarm monitor bean are optional. This operation gives information on which optional operations are implemented and will not throw UnsupportedOperationException.

    The following operation prototypes can be returned:
  • BadAlarmReferenceValue[] unacknowledgeAlarms( String[], String ackUserId, String ackSystemId )

Returns:
String[] List of operation names that will not throw UnsupportedOperationException, if they are called.

getManagedEntityTypes

public java.lang.String[] getManagedEntityTypes()
Get the Managed Entity types supported by a JVT Session Bean

Returns:
String array which contains the fully qualified names of the leaf node interfaces representing the supported managed entity types. Note that it is not the implementation class name that is returned.

getQueryTypes

public java.lang.String[] getQueryTypes()
Get query types supported by the session component. All implementations must support at least query type AlarmByFilterableAlarmAttrib.

getEventTypes

public java.lang.String[] getEventTypes()
Get the event type names supported by the session component.

All implementations must support at least event types AlarmEventPropertyDesciptor.EVENT_TYPE_VALUE and AlarmListRebuildEventPropertyDesciptor.EVENT_TYPE_VALUE.

tryAcknowledgeAlarms

public javax.oss.fm.monitor.AlarmKeyResult[] tryAcknowledgeAlarms(javax.oss.fm.monitor.AlarmKey[] alarmReferenceList,
                                                                  java.lang.String ackUserId,
                                                                  java.lang.String ackSystemId)
                                                           throws javax.oss.IllegalArgumentException
Acknowledges one or more alarms in server's Alarm List.

The function registers the time of operation in ackTime in Alarm in Alarm List. It also registers ackUserId in Alarm. It sets ackState to acknowledged as well.

The ackTime, ackUserId and ackState are collectively called Acknowledgement Information.

As a result of this operation the server will emit message about Acknowledgement Information.

Note that the time of acknowledgement is not parameter in this function. The internal time of the server is used when the function call is made instead.

If client needs to ack lots of alarms it is recommended to call this method several times instead of passing very long alarm reference list in one function call.

If the ackSystemId is not supported, see AlarmValue, by the system then the ackSystemId parameter is ignored.

Parameters:
alarmReferenceList - A array of alarm ids (AlarmKeys) to acknowledge Alarms in Alarm List.
ackUserId - A String representing the user id.
ackSystemId - A String representing the system id of the user who acknowledged the alarms, NULL denotes that the parameter is not used.
Returns:
AlarmKeyResult[] - Bad alarm reference (AlarmKey) list, if the list is empty, the call has totally succeeded. It identifies Alarms that are not present in Alarm List or that they are present, but Acknowledgement Information has not changed, in contrast to clients request. Element of this list is a pair of Alarm Reference (AlarmKey) and reason.
Throws:
javax.oss.IllegalArgumentException - Is raised when a bad argument is provided
See Also:
AlarmKeyResult

tryUnacknowledgeAlarms

public javax.oss.fm.monitor.AlarmKeyResult[] tryUnacknowledgeAlarms(javax.oss.fm.monitor.AlarmKey[] alarmReferenceList,
                                                                    java.lang.String ackUserId,
                                                                    java.lang.String ackSystemId)
                                                             throws javax.oss.IllegalArgumentException
Removes acknowledgement information from one or more alarms in server's Alarm List.

The function clears ackTime in Alarm in Alarm List. It also clears ackUserId in Alarm. It sets ackState to unacknowledged as well.

The ackTime, ackUserId and ackState are collectively called Acknowledgement Information.

As a result of this operation the server will emit message about Acknowledgement Information, where ackState is set "unacknowledged".

If client needs to ack lots of alarms it is recommended to call this method several times instead of passing very long alarm reference list in one function call.

If the ackSystemId is not supported, see AlarmValue, by the system then the ackSystemId parameter is ignored.

Parameters:
alarmReferenceList - A array of alarm ids (AlarmKeys) to unacknowledge Alarms in Alarm List.
ackUserId - A String representing the user id.
ackSystemId - A String representing the system id of the user who acknowledged the alarms, NULL denotes that the parameter is not used.
Returns:
AlarmKeyResult[] - Bad alarm reference (alarmID) list, if the list is empty, the call has totally succeeded. It identifies Alarms that are not present in Alarm List or that they are present, but Acknowledgement Information has not changed, in contrast to clients request. Element of this list is a pair of Alarm Reference (AlarmKey) and reason.
Throws:
javax.oss.UnsupportedOperationException - Is raised if this operation is not supported.
javax.oss.IllegalArgumentException - Is raised when a bad argument is provided.
See Also:
AlarmKeyResult

queryAlarmList

public javax.oss.fm.monitor.AlarmValueIterator queryAlarmList(javax.oss.QueryValue[] query,
                                                              java.lang.String[] attributes)
                                                       throws javax.oss.IllegalArgumentException
Returns alarm list. Number of retrieved alarms can be reduced by defining filter templates.

All implementations must support at least the query type defined in QueryByFilterableAttributeValue.

If the attribute list is empty, all the attribute values in the alarms are returned.

Parameters:
query - A filter made up of an array of QueryValues each containing a set of attribute values that are logically ORed together. Empty list denotes that all alarms are selected.
attributes - An array of the requested attributes.
Returns:
AlarmValueIterator - iterator for retrieving returned alarms.
Throws:
javax.oss.IllegalArgumentException - Is raised when a bad argument is provided.
See Also:
AlarmValueIterator, QueryByFilterableAttributesValue

queryAlarmCounts

public javax.oss.fm.monitor.AlarmCountsValue queryAlarmCounts(javax.oss.QueryValue[] query)
                                                       throws javax.oss.IllegalArgumentException
Returns amount of Alarms kept in server.

Possible usage is to find out the number of Alarms in Alarm List before invoking GetAlarmList operation.

All implementations must support at least the query type defined in QueryByFilterableAttributeValue.

Parameters:
query - A filter made up of an array of QueryValues each containing a set of attribute values that are logically ORed together. Empty list denotes that all alarms are selected.
Returns:
AlarmCounts - amount of Alarms in server's Alarm Information List. The datastructure AlarmCounts contains own count for each alarm severity type.
Throws:
javax.oss.IllegalArgumentException - Is raised when a bad argument is provided.
javax.oss.UnsupportedOperationException - Is raised if this operation is not supported.
See Also:
QueryByFilterableAttributesValue, AlarmCountsValue

tryCommentAlarms

public javax.oss.fm.monitor.AlarmKeyResult[] tryCommentAlarms(javax.oss.fm.monitor.AlarmKey[] alarmReferenceList,
                                                              java.lang.String commentUserId,
                                                              java.lang.String commentText,
                                                              java.lang.String commentSystemId)
                                                       throws javax.oss.IllegalArgumentException
Sets comment in one or more alarms in server's Alarm List.

As a result of this operation the server will emit messages about commented alarms.

If client needs to comment lots of alarms it is recommended to call this method several times instead of passing very long alarm reference list in one function call.

Parameters:
alarmReferenceList - A array of alarm ids (AlarmKey) to be unacknowledged.
commentUserId - A String representing the user id.
commentText - A String representing the comment.
commentSystemId - A String representing the system id of the user who generated the comment, NULL denotes that the parameter is not used.
Returns:
AlarmKeyResult[] - Bad alarm reference (AlarmKey) list, if the list is empty, the call has totally succeeded. It identifies Alarms that are not present in Alarm List or that they are present, but Acknowledgement Information has not changed, in contrast to clients request. Element of this list is a pair of Alarm Reference (AlarmKey) and reason.
Throws:
javax.oss.UnsupportedOperationException - Is raised if this operation is not supported.
javax.oss.IllegalArgumentException - Is raised when a bad argument is provided.
See Also:
AlarmKeyResult

makeAlarmValue

public javax.oss.fm.monitor.AlarmValue makeAlarmValue()
Makes an alarm value.

Returns:
AlarmValue An alarm value.

getVersion

public java.lang.String[] getVersion()
Retrieve information of the supported API versions.

The operation shall indicate compatibility with the first release of OSS QoS API.

Returns:
String[] Array of supported version strings.
